description._content: Title: O. M. Roberts Creator: Unknown Date: ca. 1874-1875 Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Place: Galveston, Galveston County, Texas Description: Portrait of Oran M. Roberts while he was Chief Justice of the Texas Supreme Court. Oran Milo Roberts (1815-1898), lawyer, governor of Texas, Senator and President of Texas Secession Convention in Austin, was instrumental in passing the ordinance that caused Texas to secede from the Union in 1861. In postwar years, Roberts served as Chief Justice of the Texas Supreme Court, and was elected governor of the state for two terms, beginning in 1878. There are several other portraits of O. M. Roberts in the Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection. (Source: Lawrence T. Jones III) Physical Description: 1 print on cabinet card mount; 16.5 x 10.5 cm. File: ag2008_0005_3_2_176_c_roberts_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,3641 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
